title: Matrices as Functions - inverse of rotation matrix

content.question:
<math alttext="A equals a 2 by 2 matrix with row 1 column 1 value cos pi over 6, row 1 column 2 value negative sin pi over 6, row 2 column 1 value sin pi over 6, row 2 column 2 value cos pi over 6"><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mi>cos</mi><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mi>sin</mi><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>sin</mi><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mi>cos</mi><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

Matrix <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> is given. The linear transformation function <math alttext="L"><mi>L</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="L open parentheses vector v close parentheses equals A inverse times vector v"><mi>L</mi><mfenced><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>, where <math alttext="A inverse"><msup><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> is the inverse of matrix <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> and <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is a column vector. Which of the following describes the linear transformation <math alttext="L"><mi>L</mi></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="L"><mi>L</mi></math> produces a rotation of vectors by <math alttext="pi over 6"><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></math> radians clockwise about the origin.
<math alttext="L"><mi>L</mi></math> produces a rotation of vectors by <math alttext="pi over 6"><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></math> radians counterclockwise about the origin.
<math alttext="L"><mi>L</mi></math> produces a rotation of vectors by <math alttext="pi over 3"><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math> radians clockwise about the origin.
<math alttext="L"><mi>L</mi></math> produces a rotation of vectors by <math alttext="pi over 3"><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math> radians counterclockwise about the origin.

content.answer: <math alttext="L"><mi>L</mi></math> produces a rotation of vectors by <math alttext="pi over 6"><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></math> radians clockwise about the origin.
